sub_title: Disaster risk management specialist - Flood and Hurricane
summary:
Flood and hurricane risk management specialist with more than ten years of experience in research and consultancy in the EU, the Caribbean and East Africa. Strong technical background in flood and hurricane modelling and studying human-flood interactions. Proven track record of building hydrodynamic and agent-based models; mapping inundated areas; assessing flood/hurricane hazard, exposure, vulnerability, overall risk and impacts (damages); assessing flood and hurricane resilience strategies; programming; and reporting. Field experience in fact-finding and needs assessment mission after a hurricane disaster and data collection for flood displacement. Independent, team player, creative and curious.

Expertise:
Physically based, numerical flood modelling; coastal and inland urban flood modelling; flood hazard, exposure, vulnerability and risk assessment; nature-based solutions for hydrometeorological hazards reduction; disaster displacement; socio-hydrology; institutional analysis and modelling; agent-based modelling; GIS data analysis, programming (Python, R, Java)

awards.title: Netherlands Fellowship Program (NFP) for MSc study
awards.description: An individual scholarship awarded in a very competitive selection to highly motivated, mid-career professionals who are in a position to introduce the newly-acquired skills and knowledge into their employing organisation. The scholarship is a contribution towards the costs of living and costs such as tuition fees, visa, travel, insurance etc.
awards.issuer: NUFFIC (The Dutch organisation for internationalisation in education)

publications.name: For a complete list of publications, please check my Google Scholar page

authors.headline: Disaster risk management specialist - Flood and Hurricane

courses.name: Complex Systems Summer School (Santa Fe Institute, Santa Fe, New Mexico, USA)

profile_positions.description: As a postdoc researcher mainly involved in the Pandemic and Disaster Preparedness Center (PDPC) frontrunner project, Pandemic lessons for flood disaster preparedness. My research at TU Delft focuses on exploring the impacts of large-scale floods on healthcare system infrastructure such as hospitals, nursing homes and ambulance services, especially developing flood hazard scenarios, quantifying direct and indirect health impacts and analyzing the effects of various preparedness strategies/measures.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

company.name: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education

profile_positions.company: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education
profile_positions.description:
As a postdoc researcher involved in EU funded Horizon 2020 project RECONECT (Regenerating ecosystems with nature-based solutions for hydro-meteorological risk reduction). RECONECT aims to enhance the European reference framework on Nature Based Solutions (NBS) for hydro-meteorological risk reduction by demonstrating, referencing, upscaling and exploiting large-scale NBS in rural and natural areas. Main activities and achievements include: 
● Improving and developing models for planning and evaluating NBS that reduce hydro-meteorological risk
● Writing and reviewing deliverables
● Undertaking various project management tasks
● Supervising students
profile_positions.title: Researcher RECONECT Project

company.name: Platform on Disaster Displacement (PDD), hosted by UNOPS

profile_positions.company: Platform on Disaster Displacement (PDD), hosted by UNOPS
profile_positions.description:
As an individual consultant supporting the PDD on the Data and Knowledge challenges of the joint Migration Multi-Partner Trust Fund programme titled "Addressing Drivers and Facilitating Safe, Orderly and Regular Migration in the Contexts of Disasters and Climate Change in the IGAD Region". Main activities and achievements include:
●  Selection of pilot areas for data collection
●  Conducting semi-structured interviews and coordinating household surveys for a decision-making model concerning local people's needs, disaster displacement experience, risk perception, attitude towards migration and social interactions
●  Technical support for the decision-making model – an agent-based model that simulates the effects of different policy options, investments and programmatic interventions
profile_positions.title: Data Analyst (Decision-Making Model Interviews Consultant)

company.name: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education

profile_positions.company: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education
profile_positions.description:
As a PhD research fellow involved in EU funded projects PEARL (http://www.pearl-fp7.eu/) and RECONECT (http://www.reconect.eu/). Main activities and achievements include: 
● Developing coupled agent-based and flood (hydraulic) models for the cases of  Hamburg, Germany and the Caribbean island of Sint Maarten
● Writing deliverables
● Fact-finding and needs assessment mission to the Caribbean island of Sint Maarten in the aftermath of Hurricane Irma. Mission duties and responsibilities include: 
   - Conducting workshops, interviews and household surveys regarding hurricane/flood warnings, evacuations, preparedness, people’s awareness of their impacts and organizational responses after a hurricane/flood
   - Collecting drainage system and weather data
   - Setting up hydrodynamic models for Hurricane Irma wind field and storm surge simulation
   - Improving existing flood model based on the hurricane simulation results 
   - Updating hurricane/flood hazard, vulnerability and risk maps
   - Identifying hurricane/flood adaptation measures
   - Providing recommendation to build back better
   - Produce reports
profile_positions.title: Graduate Research Fellow

profile_positions.company: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education
profile_positions.description:
As a researcher asisstant in a Flood Risk Assessment project in the Caribbean island of Sint Maarten. The project was financed by the European Commission and implemented by UNDP Barbados and OECS under the Regional Risk Reduction Initiative. Main activities and achievements include:
● Estimation of shallow water depth bathymetry (input for coastal modelling) combining
satellite images and sonar measurements using a Support Vector Machine algorithm
● Rainfall-runoff analysis
● Hurricane and storm surge simulations using MIKE21 Flow model
● Combined coastal and inland flood simulation using MIKE FLOOD (a coupled MIKE11 and MIKE21 Flow Models)
● Flood hazard, exposure, vulnerability and risk assessments based on model results and using ArcGIS
● Evaluate flood risk reduction strategies (structural and non-structural measures)
● Produce reports and technical notes
profile_positions.title: Researcher Assistant

profile_positions.description:
As an Instructor and Researcher with the capacity of Graduate Assistant and Assistant Lecturer in the Department of Agricultural Engineering, Jimma University College of Agriculture and Veterinary Medicine. 𝘈𝘸𝘢𝘳𝘥𝘦𝘥 𝘢𝘯 𝘌𝘹𝘤𝘦𝘭𝘭𝘦𝘯𝘤𝘦 𝘪𝘯 𝘛𝘦𝘢𝘤𝘩𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘈𝘸𝘢𝘳𝘥 𝘵𝘸𝘪𝘤𝘦, 𝘪𝘯 2007/2008 𝘢𝘯𝘥 2008/2009! Main activities and achievements include:
● Teaching introductory courses (Hydrology and Irrigation Engineering)
● Assisting and supervising practical sessions
● Collaborating in research activities (FAO-Sustainable Land Management Project in Kafa Zone, SNNPR, Ethiopia and VLIR-UOS IUC-JU Partnership, member of soil fertility team)
profile_positions.title: Assistant Lecturer and Researcher
